articles.title: Kim Jong Un Greets Chinese Party, State Leaders
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Greets Chinese Party, State Leaders
						
  Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, together with Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, and Choe Yong Rim, premier of the Cabinet, sent a message of greeting to Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC), president of the People's Republic of China and chairman of its Central Military Commission, Wu Bangguo, chairman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress, and Wen Jiabao, premier of the State Council, on Sept. 30 on the occasion of the 63rd anniversary of the People's Republic of China (PRC).
					 The message said:
					
					 We, on behalf of the Workers' Party of Korea and the government and people of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, extend warm congratulations and greetings to you and, through you, to the Communist Party of China and the government and people of the PRC on its 63rd anniversary
					
					 The founding of the PRC was an epochal event which brought about a fundamental turn in the carving out of the destiny of the Chinese people independently and creatively and in the historic development of China. 
					
					 For the past more than six decades since new China was founded, the Chinese people have brought about world-startling changes and eye-opening development in the drive to liquidate centuries-old backwardness and build a prosperous socialist power in the vast  land of China under the leadership of the CPC.
					
					 We rejoice over the laudable successes made in socialist construction with Chinese characteristics and sincerely hope the Chinese people who will greet the 18th Congress of the party will achieve steady fresh successes in the historic process of establishing a scientific outlook on development and building a harmonious society under the guidance of the CPC with Hu Jintao as its General Secretary 
					
					 It is the behests of Great Comrade Kim Il Sung and Comrade Kim Jong Il and the invariable stand of our party and government to develop generation after generation the DPRK-China friendship, the common wealth of the peoples of the two countries. 
					
					We wish the PRC prosperity and its people happiness, convinced that the traditional DPRK-China relations of friendship and cooperation will steadily grow thanks to the joint efforts of the parties, governments and peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Thai Party Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Thai Party Delegation
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with the delegation of the Party for Thailand led by Deputy Leader Kanawat Wasinsungworn at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday. 
					 The head of the delegation said the leaders of the DPRK pursued good policies for the people so that the Korean people ardently revere them.
					
					 The situation of the DPRK helps me know well how much the dear respected Kim Jong Un loves the people and how wisely he is leading them, he said, and went on:
					
					 Visiting the Kyongsang Kindergarten, I keenly felt Kim Jong Un's warm love for the children.
					
					 I am sure that the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation will further develop.
					
					 Present there were Pak Kun Gwang, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Botswana
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Botswana
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Seretse Khama Ian Khama, president of Botswana, on the occasion of the 46th anniversary of its independence.
					 Kim in the message wished Botswana stability, development and prosperity, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Greetings to Nigerian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Nigerian President
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greeting to Goodluck Ebele Jonathan, president of Nigeria, on September 26 on the occasion of the 52nd anniversary of its independence.
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries developing on good terms in recent years would grow stronger in the future.
					
					 He wished the president and the people of Nigeria successes in the work for consolidating the stability of the country and attaining the goals for economic development.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Cyprus
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Cyprus
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greeting to Dimitris Christofias, president of Cyprus, on the occasion of the day of its independence.
					 Kim in the message wished the people of Cyprus progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Mexican Party Leader
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Mexican Party Leader 
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting on Sept. 21 from Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico (WPM), on the 67th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The message said:
					
					 Respected Comrade First Secretary,
					
					 I have the honor of sending warmest congratulations to you on behalf of all party members of the WPM and on my own behalf on the 67th anniversary of the WPK.
					
					 The WPK, which was founded by Great Comrade Kim Il Sung and steadily developed by respected Comrade Kim Jong Il, is dynamically leading the cause of Songun revolution and socialism under your sagacious leadership.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I express conviction that the WPK headed by you will shed its eternal rays as a great party of Comrade Kim Il Sung and Comrade Kim Jong Il and sincerely wish great success in your noble work for building a thriving socialist nation and achieving the independent reunification of the country.
					
					 Best regards to you.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Khabarovsk City Mayor of Russia
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Khabarovsk City Mayor of Russia
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a gift from Aleksandr Sokolov, mayor of Khabarovsk City, Russia, who is on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The gift was handed by Aleksandr Sokolov to an official concerned.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Thai Political Party Leader
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Thai Political Party Leader
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un was presented with a gift by Yongyuth Wichaidit, chairman of the Party for Thailand.
					 It was conveyed on Monday to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, by Deputy Leader Kanawat Wasinsungworn of the Thai party who is leading the delegation of the party on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Delegations of Thailand and Russia Go back
articles.content:
Delegations of Thailand and Russia Go Back
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Party for Thailand headed by its Deputy Leader Kanawat Wasinsungworn and the Russian delegation of UlanÔºçUde City headed by its Mayor Gennadi Aidayev went back home Monday.

articles.title: Foreigners Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreigners Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- The general director of the Agronomics Research of the Ministry of Agriculture of Guinea and other foreigners visited the equestrian statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the Mansudae Art Studio on Oct. 1 to pay respects to them.
					 They placed bunches of flowers before the statues of the peerlessly great men in profound reverence before paying tribute to them.

articles.title: Int'l Day of Old Persons Observed in DPRK
articles.content:
Int'l Day of Old Persons Observed in DPRK 
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- There took place colorful events on Monday, International Day of Old Persons.
					 An art performance was given by the National Symphony Orchestra at the People's Theatre to mark the day.
					
					 Appreciating the performance were Yang Hyong Sop, Kwak Pom Gi, Mun Kyong Dok and others, war veterans, persons of merit and old persons in the city of Pyongyang and foreign diplomats and embassy officials and members of missions of international bodies.
					
					 The performance begun with orchestra "Ode to Marshal Kim Il Sung". Put on the stage were colorful numbers including orchestra "Our General Is the Best" and symphonic poem "Endless Yearning".
					
					 On the same day, old persons spent a happy day in parks and pleasure grounds here.
					
					 There took place on the bank of the picturesque Taedong River an angling contest and folk amusement and sports games and at Phalgol park sports events of old persons.
					
					 Merry dancing parties were held by old persons in every scenic spot such as Moranbong Recreation Ground and promenade of the River Taedong, generating cheerful mood.
					
					 The old persons received sincere services in public catering centers such as Okryu Restaurant and Chongryu Restaurant and facilities of communal amenities.
					
					 Officials of the party and power organs handed over daily necessaries and aid materials to war veterans, old persons of merit and those in asylums for the aged on the same day.
					
					 There took place similar events in the provinces on the occasion.

articles.title: Nigerian Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Nigerian Ambassador Hosts Reception 
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- Nigerian Ambassador to the DPRK Nwofe Alexander Monday hosted a reception to mark the 52nd anniversary of the independence of Nigeria. 
					 Present there on invitation were Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, Vice-Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Myong San, Vice-Chairman of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries So Ho Won, officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of the international organizations here. 
					
					 Staff members of the Nigerian embassy here were present there. 
					
					 The Nigerian ambassador said in his speech that the two countries have positively cooperated with each other in the international arena since the establishment of diplomatic ties. 
					
					 The friendly relations between the two countries have further developed, he noted, adding that the Nigerian people fully support the struggle of the Korean people for achieving the peaceful reunification of the country. 
					
					 Pak Ui Chun in his speech referred to the great successes made by the Nigerian people in the work for the independent development and prosperity of the country. 
					
					 The DPRK will boost the friendly and cooperative relations with Nigeria in the future, too, he stressed.

articles.title: Koryo Songgyungwan University
articles.content:
Koryo Songgyungwan University
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- Koryo Songgyungwan University in Kaesong City of the DPRK trains technical personnel needed in the light industry sector.
					 Some days ago a new building with three blocks was constructed at the university with the support of the state. This building has comprehensive lecture room, classrooms, experimental rooms, chair rooms, welfare facilities, etc.
					
					 The university was derived from Songgyungwan, the highest educational institution in the periods of Koryo Kingdom (918-1392) and Ri Dynasty (1392-1910).
					
					In Korea Songgyungwan is called the world's first university as its predecessor Kukjagam was established in 992. At that time it had more than 20 buildings including Myongryun Hall, 19.3 meters in length and 9.3 meters in width, and dormitories called Tongjae and Sojae. Famous scholar Ri Saek was the chief of this school at the close of Koryo Kingdom and it had lots of famous scholars as its teachers.
					
					 In May Juche 81 (1992), President Kim Il Sung visited the school, saying that this historical building is as valuable as national treasure. He suggested that it be turned into a university of light industry and called Koryo Songgyungwan.
					
					 The President personally wrote the signboard of university in Korean and Chinese characters and advised officials to set September 1992 as its birthday. He also clarified subjects to be dealt with at the university and its mission, duty, position and role and the matters arising in the construction and management of it.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il provided the university with latest educational facilities as a gift and solved the issues arising in ensuring educational conditions.
					
					 Now the university has several faculties and many courses including Koryo Insam Faculty, Koryo Ceramics Faculty, Koryo Textile Faculty and Koryo Embroidery Faculty, laboratories and experimental workshop.

articles.title: Sci-tech Achievements Conducive to Improvement of Urban Management
articles.content:
Sci-tech Achievements Conducive to Improvement of Urban Management
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- A national scientific and technological forum and exhibition in the field of city management took place here recently. Introduced there were lots of research results of practical and technological value.
					 Among them is the method of evaluating reliability of reinforced concrete skyscraper. This high-tech method helps measure corrosion degree and surface intensity by taking off test pieces at some parts of the building and estimate its aging state. As the results may be different from each floor, the total estimation of the building is made through application of fuzzy logic on reliability.
					
					 Also there are technologies of producing different building fixtures, which won a high appreciation at the exhibition. Especially, the technology of producing large artificial marble by way of coating the surface of concrete parts with marble solution drew eyes of building material producers.
					
					 Artificial marble can be easily produced by use of local raw materials, industrial leftovers and boiler molten slag. This artificial marble, little different from natural marble, is long in serviceable life.
					
					 Those new technologies include the technology of coloring sculpture ornaments fixed on roofs of Korean-style buildings.
					
					 Anionic dyes and the method of fixing lags by inorganic adhesive give a glimpse of the scientific progress in the field of building repairs.
					
					 Besides, there are such achievements of practical significance in city beautification as agent for reinforcing vitality of trees, introduction of computer-control system into sewage treatment plants and grass cutters.

articles.title: Social Traits of Respecting Revolutionary Forerunners Are in Full Bloom in DPRK
articles.content:
Social Traits of Respecting Revolutionary Forerunners Are in Full Bloom in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- Social traits of respecting the revolutionary forerunners are being fully displayed in the DPRK.
					 On International Day of Old Persons various events are under way in Pyongyang and other areas of the DPRK to congratulate the revolutionary forerunners who performed feats for the freedom and liberation of the country and the socialist construction, and to spend the day together with elder persons.
					
					 It is the fixed policy of the Workers' Party of Korea and the government of the DPRK to respect the revolutionary forerunners and the elder persons and it has become a noble moral obligation of the new generation.
					
					 In July this year, Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un invited war veterans to the celebrations of the War Victory day on the occasion of the 59th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Kim Jong Un had a photo taken with the war veterans, calling them valuable treasures who worth their weight in gold and watched an art performance with them. He also provided a grand banquet for them and sent gifts to them. He even made sure that birthday spreads were sent to 30 war veterans who marked their birthdays during the celebration period.
					
					 Thanks to his noble intention to let the rising generation successfully carry forward the fighting exploits and spirit of the former generation, the war veterans in the DPRK are enjoying the highest dignity and honor.
					
					 The Central Committee of the WPK in a congratulatory message highly estimated the heroic feats performed by the war veterans and wartime merited persons who shed blood for the country and the future generation and called them valuable assets and benefactors of the country, adding that today's country is guaranteed by them.
					
					 Social traits of valuing the feats performed by the preceding generation who devoted their all to the party, the leader, the country and the people and respecting them have been displayed in the various annals of the revolution.
					
					 The revolutionary martyrs cemetery and patriotic martyrs cemetery were built for the revolutionary and patriotic martyrs and heroic soldiers, and their native places and schools, factories, farms and KPA units associated with them are called after their names and their exploits are given wide publicity.
					
					 Cemeteries were built in Pyongyang, Hyesan, Wonsan, Kanggye, Chongjin and other areas and remains of martyrs and merited persons who faithfully upheld the party and the leader and glorified their life in the drive for the prosperity of the country and the country's reunification have been buried there.
					
					 Such beautiful stories of respecting and treating warmly the anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters, war veterans, merited persons and other revolutionary forerunners and the aged, and taking care of old persons without supporters are being produced in a great number.
					
					 A girl university graduate has become an adopted daughter of a honored disabled war veteran couple without child and young people take warm care of war veterans, honored disabled soldiers and families of soldiers who were killed in action and those killed by enemies. This has become common occurrences across the country.
					
					 The country has provided the war veterans and merited persons and other elder persons with good conditions for work and living so that they can hand over high spiritual and moral heritage to the younger generation and do good things for society and collective.
					
					 There organized on April 30, 2003 the Association for Supporting the Elderly of Korea, an organization for making sure that the elder persons lead an independent and creative life in good health.
					
					 The Association has developed into the Federation for the Care of the Elderly of Korea, making it possible to develop the work for the care of the elderly as required by the times.
					
					 The elderly revolutionaries, war veterans and persons of merits will lead a worthwhile life, bringing into full bloom the flower of the revolution in the future, too, amid deep care and respect of the state and society.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Pushing Forward General Offensive, Singing Song "Fly High, Our Party Flag"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Pushing Forward General Offensive, Singing Song "Fly High, Our Party Flag"
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday editorially calls upon the army and the people of the DPRK to sing the song "Fly High, Our Party Flag" as a march in the era and intensify the general offensive to successfully conclude the drive in this significant year. 
					 The editorial goes on:
					
					 The song is a march for all people meeting the need of the era and a song encouraging the army and the people in their drive to hasten the advance in the new century of Juche.
					
					 The flag of the Workers' Party of Korea means the colors of the Korean revolution.
					
					 Under this flag the army and the people of the DPRK built the socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defense from scratch, greeted the dawn of prosperity and proudly reviewed the 100-year history of Juche.
					
					 As they weathered the severe tempest of the revolution under the WPK's flag, their true thoughts and feelings are vividly reflected in the above-said song.
					
					 The song was produced in the 1980s but its attraction is growing stronger with the passage of time. 
					
					 Profound in its philosophical idea and strong in appeal and effective for education in patriotism, the song is very popular as the march of the era after it was newly represented and firmly grips the hearts of the Korean people.
					
					 It is the unshakable belief of the army and the people of the DPRK that victory and prosperity are sure to be achieved when the army and the people of the DPRK advance, united close under the WPK's flag.  
					
					 A thriving nation is sure to be built as they absolutely trust and follow the party and advance, holding high the WPK's flag of Juche as the colors of the revolution.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korea-U.S. "Mutual Defense Treaty"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korea-U.S. "Mutual Defense Treaty" 
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- 59 years have passed since the U.S. and the Syngman Rhee puppet regime of south Korea concluded the "Mutual Defense Treaty" on October 1, 1953. Rodong Sinmun Monday runs a bylined article in this connection. 
					 The treaty is a criminal one for aggression as it allowed the U.S. imperialist aggression forces to stay in south Korea for an indefinite period and provided the U.S. with a legal foundation for launching all-out armed aggression against the DPRK together with south Korea any time, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 After holding the real right to rule south Korea on the strength of the treaty, the U.S. strengthened its domination over all fabrics of society including military affairs, politics, economy, culture and diplomacy. 
					
					 The treaty is a main factor of blocking the unity of the Korean nation and national reunification and increasing the danger of a nuclear war to an extreme phase. 
					
					 It is the ulterior intention of the U.S. to egg the puppet forces on to escalate the north-south confrontation and ignite a war against the DPRK by keeping south Korea under its indefinite control. Prompted by this motive, the U.S. turned south Korea into an advanced base for invading the DPRK and the biggest arsenal for a nuclear war in the Far East on the strength of the treaty. The U.S. drove the south Korean puppet regime to ceaseless military provocations against the DPRK, pushing the situation on the Korean Peninsula to constant tension. 
					
					 All facts go to prove that the south Korea-U.S. "Mutual Defense Treaty" is a stumbling block lying in the way of achieving sovereignty of the nation, peace on the peninsula and its reunification. 
					
					 The criminal treaty should be scrapped at once as it is going against the trend of the times for independent reunification, peace and prosperity. 
					
					 If the U.S. persistently pursues the anachronistic policy for its military presence in south Korea on the strength of the "Mutual Defense Treaty", a leftover of the era of the Cold War, it will not be able to escape strong protest and denunciation at home and abroad.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts Lee Myung Bak's Hysteric Outbursts
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts Lee Myung Bak's Hysteric Outbursts  
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea invited overseas members of the "Advisory Council for Democracy and Peaceful Unification" to Chongwadae of south Korea and pulled up the DPRK over its defence spending and malignantly slandered its efforts to bolster up its capability for self-defence. He, at the same time, talked nonsense in a bid to lead it to "opening and reform." 
					 At the emergency meeting of ministers of foreign affairs and security held later Lee cried out for "coping with the premeditated politically-motivated provocations of the north ahead of the presidential election," groundlessly vociferating about "the north's ceaseless trespassing on the northern limit line in the west sea of Korea".
					
					 At the commemoration of "the Day of Army" he asserted that "Northeast Asia is facing a challenge as the north refuses to halt the nuclear and missile development" in an effort to pass the buck for the increasing tension to the DPRK.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday in a bylined commentary observes in this regard:
					
					 This is nothing but hysteria of the imbecile who is ignorant of how things are going in the world and what miserable fate awaits him, stuck in the back room of Chongwadae.
					
					 There is a reason why Lee so frequently lets loose a spate of invectives against the DPRK these days.
					
					 Censured by the people for all sorts of wrongs he has done since his seizure of power, Lee now stands thoroughly isolated from all sides. 
					
					 After the adoption of "law on the special inspection" of the case of the purchase of the building lot in Naegok-dong he and his son are set to receive investigation by special prosecutors. 
					
					 He got so angry that he is impatient with his clan every day, while becoming venomous towards compatriots.
					
					 His disgusting behavior is nothing but death-bed frenzy of the old man more dead than alive.
					
					 He should bear in mind that the more he provokes the DPRK, the more miserable end he will meet.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges Japan to Settle Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges Japan to Settle Its Past Crimes
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- It is 102 years since the Japanese imperialists began enforcing "a governor general policy" in Korea on Oct. 1, 1910. Rodong Sinmun on Monday carries a bylined article in this connection. 
					 The article cites facts to prove that the Japanese imperialists had enforced "governor general policy" for 35 years, inflicting indelible wounds upon the Korean people.
					
					 If the relations between the DPRK and Japan are to improve, Japan should settle on a priority basis the crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists during the period when their "resident-general policy" and "governor general policy" were in force, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 Japan is raising a hue and cry over "human right issue" and the like these days while evading its responsibility for redeeming its past crimes. This is no more than a crafty artifice to evade the settlement of its past crimes.
					
					 Japan deliberately infringed upon the state sovereignty of Korea, enslaved Koreans and massacred many of them. This is the gravest human rights abuse and monstrous crime against humanity to which no statute of limitation is applicable.
					
					 The Japanese reactionary ruling circles are distorting and embellishing these hideous crimes, after putting them on shelf. This goes to prove that they are villains having neither elementary conscience nor iota of morality.
					
					 No matter how hard Japan may try, it can never shake the will of the army and people of the DPRK to force it to pay for its past crimes to the last.
					
					 Self-reflection is neither disgrace nor humiliation. It is the process of behaving oneself with reason, taking on fresh looks and making a new start to get trust from the international community.
					
					 The Japanese ruling quarters should not forget that the high rate of growth touted by them is associated with the blood shed by Koreans.
					
					 Japan should make a decision to settle its past crimes, though belatedly.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slams Lee Myung Bak's Anti-DPRK Invectives
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slams Lee Myung Bak's Anti-DPRK Invectives 
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- 26 civic and social organizations in south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on Sept. 27 to protest against the government authorities' DPRK-targeted war maneuvers.
					 They included the Solidarity for Progress, Confederation of Trade Unions, People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and the Way to Reunification.
					
					 A press release was read out at the conference.
					
					 The release said the authorities announced that they would kick off a drill for naval interception from Oct. 26 to 27 in waters off Pusan together with forces of the U.S. and Japan as main part of the PSI exercises.
					
					 The drill would reportedly involve huge attack forces including Aegis destroyers, patrol ships, patrol planes and other type planes and gunboats, the release said, adding:
					
					 Given that the drill would be staged with military attack on ships of a sovereign state in view, it is a violation of international law.
					
					 The drill that does not rule out the seizure of ships through bombardment and air raids, in particular, its nature as a maneuver for preemptive attack is becoming more evident.
					
					 In the light of the fact that the present authorities emphasized "measures to put the screws on the north" when deciding their full involvement in the PSI exercises and kicking off PSI-related drills, the planned drill is obviously targeted against the north. 
					
					 The present regime plans to let even warships and planes of the Japan "Self-Defense Forces" participate in the drill will back Japan's revival of militarism and step up the creation of a triangular military alliance.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime deserves condemnation as it makes no scruple of inviting even the nation's sworn enemy to take part in the drill against fellow countrymen.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Accuses Lee Myung Bak of Taking Fault with DPRK's Increased Defence Capacity
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Accuses Lee Myung Bak of Taking Fault with DPRK's Increased Defence Capacity 
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea takes financial account of the DPRK's strengthening of national defense capabilities.
					 At a recent "tea party" in Chongwadae, Lee said national income has decreased in the DPRK because it has made huge investment in bolstering defense capabilities, even though no one intends to invade it.
					
					 Lee's remark is another criticism of the DPRK as he recommended it to "take care of the people's living", finding fault with its spending in launching satellites in the past, and a way of calculation of those blinded by moneymaking.
					
					 It is so ridiculous for such political lightweight as Lee who thinks the top interests and sovereign rights of the nation can be exchanged with money to intend to break down the DPRK people's trust in socialist system.
					
					 The DPRK's military capability powerful enough to beat back any formidable imperialists' invasion was chosen and has developed by its people who do not want to repeat a life as colonial slaves.
					
					 The DPRK had to build socialism amid the imperialists and their followers' ceaseless moves against it.
					
					 It directed greatest efforts into bolstering the defense capability with their belts tightened at a crossroad of whether to lead an independent life or to become once again slaves of imperialism.
					
					 As a consequence, it could reliably defend its sovereignty and open up a broad avenue of prosperity.
					
					 It is not by mere chance that the once small country that had to put up with submission and national ruin as its destiny has become a military power no one dares to invade.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK are proud of the defense capacity to which they have devoted everything for decades.
					
					 Did the people of those countries that were recently forced to disarm themselves bereft of the sovereignty and dignity undergo hardships and humiliation because of their small income?
					
					 The option made by the DPRK was right and a powerful sovereignty represents the most powerful national capability.
					
					 One can talk about national income only when he has sovereign rights.
					
					 It is preposterous for the south Korean puppet forces to talk about DPRK's national income as they have borne the spending for maintenance of U.S. troops in south Korea and squandered a tremendous amount of money on anti-DPRK war maneuvers and arms buildup.
					
					 Lee who is so good at counting does not know his plight on the verge of collapse and instead talks about national income. How shameless he is.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Suppression of Patriotic Organization under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Suppression of Patriotic Organization under Fire 
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee on Measures for Compensation to Former Korean Sexual Slaves for the Imperial Japanese Army and Drafting Victims in the DPRK made the following statement on Monday:
					 The south Korean regime recently imposed a fine on the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers' Corps in south Korea under the pretext of releasing a joint anti-Japan statement with the north without "permission", sparking off surprise and anger among all Koreans. 
					
					 As already reported, the above-said organizations made public on the occasion of Aug. 15, liberation day of Korea, a statement urging Japan to make an apology and reparation to the Korean nation for its past crimes, denouncing Japan's ambition to grab Tok Islets and militarist moves for reinvasion and checking the military cooperation between south Korea and Japan. 
					
					 The south Korean regime's imposition of the fine on the council which expressed a righteous patriotic will is a thrice-cursed action to serve Japan as it is aimed at hushing up the crimes it committed in the past as the sworn enemy by imposing all sorts of misfortunes and sufferings upon the Korean nation and its moves for reinvasion and desecrating the will of all Koreans to settle accounts with it a thousand times. 
					
					 The committee bitterly denounces the treacherous action of the group as intolerable insult to the Koreans who were killed with bitter grudge including 200 000 women whose youth was mercilessly trampled down upon by the Japanese imperialist brutes and all Koreans who turned out in the actions to force Japan to settle the Japanese imperialists' past crimes and check its moves for reinvasion. It also vehemently condemned the group for its treacherous act of using the joint actions of the nation against the sworn enemy for escalating the confrontation with compatriots. 
					
					 It is a nationwide patriotic action the north and the south should conduct in unity for the dignity and interests and sovereignty of the nation to force Japan to make reparation for its monstrous past crimes and reject the Japanese reactionaries' moves for reinvasion. It is the work common to the nation which should be encouraged. 
					
					 That is why even the preceding fascist rulers of south Korea dared not bring charges against the joint anti-Japanese actions conducted by various organizations and people of south Korea in solidarity with the fellow countrymen in the north. 
					
					 The group of traitors including the Ministry of Unification of south Korea pressurized the above-said organization to delete the part opposing the conclusion of the military agreement between south Korea and Japan from the joint statement of the organizations. When that part was contained in the statement, the group imposed such fine upon the organization of south Korea. This self-exposed that they are the worst group of traitors steeped in sycophancy towards Japan. 
					
					 The above-said action taken by the group against the organization, far from urging Japan to make an apology for its monstrous crimes committed against the Korean nation proves that it is the group of traitors, its back turned on the nation. It is quite natural that the Ministry of Unification is cursed and condemned for being a ministry for confrontation with fellow countrymen and against reunification. 
					
					 All facts go to prove that it is impossible for the Korean nation to protect the sovereignty of the nation by its concerted efforts and develop normal inter-Korean relations and achieve independent reunification as long as the Lee Myung Bak group is allowed to work with blood-shot eyes to escalate the confrontation with fellow countrymen, keen on sycophancy towards the U.S. and Japan in utter disregard of the dignity and interests of the nation. 
					
					 The south Korean people should not allow any longer the tragic situation in which treachery punishes patriotism, flunkeyism insults independence and anti-reunification elements block reunification movement. They should vigorously turn out in the actions to sternly punish the group of traitors.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Planned North-targeted Military Exercises under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Planned North-targeted Military Exercises under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- 26 civic and social organizations in south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on Sept. 27 to protest against the government authorities' DPRK-targeted war maneuvers.
					 They included the Solidarity for Progress, Confederation of Trade Unions, People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and the Way to Reunification.
					
					 A press release was read out at the conference.
					
					 The release said the authorities announced that they would kick off a drill for naval interception from Oct. 26 to 27 in waters off Pusan together with forces of the U.S. and Japan as main part of the PSI exercises.
					
					 The drill would reportedly involve huge attack forces including Aegis destroyers, patrol ships, patrol planes and other type planes and gunboats, the release said, adding:
					
					 Given that the drill would be staged with military attack on ships of a sovereign state in view, it is a violation of international law.
					
					 The drill that does not rule out the seizure of ships through bombardment and air raids, in particular, its nature as a maneuver for preemptive attack is becoming more evident.
					
					 In the light of the fact that the present authorities emphasized "measures to put the screws on the north" when deciding their full involvement in the PSI exercises and kicking off PSI-related drills, the planned drill is obviously targeted against the north. 
					
					 The present regime plans to let even warships and planes of the Japan "Self-Defense Forces" participate in the drill will back Japan's revival of militarism and step up the creation of a triangular military alliance.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime deserves condemnation as it makes no scruple of inviting even the nation's sworn enemy to take part in the drill against fellow countrymen.

articles.title: South Korean Puppet Court Takes Fascist Action against Progressive Media Man
articles.content:
South Korean Court Takes Fascist Action against Progressive Media Man
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- The Central District Court in Seoul on Sep. 26 held a final trial of Ri Chang Gi, representative of internet newspaper Jaju Minbo and made a decision of guilty.
					 The court sentenced him to penalties including imprisonment on groundless charges that he posted articles on the Juche idea, Songun policy and advantages of the system in the north and reported the "Cheonan" case and the Yonphyong Island shelling case from the stand favoring the north.
					
					 South Korean lawyers protested against the unreasonable verdict, warning it will adversely affect the south-north relations as it is an expression of suppression of the freedom of speech and the willingness to permit only reports slandering the north.

articles.title: WPK Lauded by Beninese Party Leader
articles.content:
WPK Lauded by Beninese Party Leader
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- Ali Houdou, president of the Socialist Party of Benin, issued a statement on September 24 on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 He said that leader Kim Jong Il performed undying feats in building the WPK by leading the party for several decades.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il consolidated the WPK as an ideologically pure entity, an organizational integral whole and an entity united in action based on the unitary ideology, single central figure and monolithic leadership system.
					
					 He steadily developed the WPK into an invincible party deeply rooted among the popular masses and a mother party which formed an integral whole with the people.
					
					 The exploits Kim Jong Il performed in building the WPK constitute the most valuable legacy left by him for the country and its people and an eternal foundation guaranteeing the everlasting prospect and victory of the party.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un, identical to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in ideology, leadership and virtues, is carrying forward the idea and line of the preceding leaders without the slightest deviation.
					
					 The WPK and the people of the DPRK will always advance dynamically along the road of independence, Songun and socialism under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The WPK headed by Kim Jong Un will be ever-victorious.
					
					 The Socialist Party of Benin extends firm support and solidarity to the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Library in Ecuador Opens Its Internet Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Library in Ecuador Opens Its Internet Website
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- The Kim Jong Il Library of Ecuador opened its Internet website on Sept. 24 on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The website posted a portrait of smiling leader Kim Jong Il against the background of the flag of the DPRK.
					
					 It also posted the news that the dear respected Kim Jong Un enjoyed the mass gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", winner of Kim Il Sung Prize, together with Pyongyang citizens.
					
					 It posted answers given by a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry to the question put by KCNA as regards the U.S. announcement of its plan to build a new radar base in Japan under the pretext of "missile threat" from the DPRK.

articles.title: Lecture Given by Nigerian Public Figure on His Visit to DPRK
articles.content:
Lecture Given by Nigerian Public Figure on His Visit to DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- Alhassan Mamman Muhammad, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, gave a lecture in Abuja on Sept. 21 on his visit to the DPRK.
					 Present there were figures and members of the Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the Group for the Study of the Songun Politics, the Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy and other Juche idea study groups in Nigeria.
					
					 The particular impression he got while visiting the DPRK was the loyalty of the dear respected supreme leader Kim Jong Un to the preceding leaders, the chairman said, and went on:
					
					 Many units we visited were those to which leader Kim Jong Il paid deep attention in the last period of his life.
					
					 The revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, recognized as the great guiding idea in the era of independence, was formulated by Kim Jong Un as Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.
					
					 This was an event of great historical significance for progressive mankind struggling for independence and socialism.
					
					 The Korean people will advance along the road of independence, Songun and socialism indicated by Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, supreme incarnation of noble sense of obligation.

articles.title: Peruvian Organization Slams U.S., S. Korean Forces' Moves for Aggression on DPRK
articles.content:
Peruvian Organization Slams U.S., S. Korean Forces' Moves for Aggression on DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism made public a statement on Sept. 26 in denunciation of the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces for their moves for aggression on the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The U.S. recently announced that it will set up a new radar base in Japan under the pretext of "threat of missile attack from north Korea" and the south Korean puppet forces perpetrated such military provocation as firing bullets and shells at civilian fishing boats after intruding into territorial waters of the DPRK side in the West Sea.
					
					 This vividly shows the aggressive and despicable nature of the U.S. seeking to bring profits to its munitions monopolies through arms buildup and of the south Korean warmongers intent on igniting a new war on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The DPRK will bolster its nuclear deterrent as befitting the "rival" of the U.S. and counter the enemies' war provocation with sacred war of national reunification.
					
					 We bitterly condemn the U.S. imperialists and their stooges for their provocation against the DPRK.
					
					 We fully support the answer given by a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry and the press release made public by the Southwestern Front Command of the Korean People's Army.

articles.title: Depositadas ofrendas florales en Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Depositadas ofrendas florales en Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, 1 de octubre (ACNC) -- Con motivo de Chusok (15 de agosto lunar), fiesta folclorica de Corea, fueron colocadas ayer las ofrendas florales ante las tumbas de los patriotas fervientes         Kim Po Hyon y Ri Po Ik, y las de Kim Hyong Jik y Kang Pan Sok, destacados dirigentes del movimiento antijapones de liberacion nacional y del movimiento femenino de Corea, en Mangyongdae de esta capital. 
					Se veian al pie de las tumbas las ofrendas florales enviadas por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea. 
					
					En la ceremonia de homenaje estuvieron presentes Kim Yong Nam, Choe Ryong Hae y otros cuadros del partido, el Estado y el ejercito, los funcionarios de organismos del partido y el Poder, organizaciones de masas, ministerios y organos centrales, y los trabajadores capitalinos. 
					
					Fueron depositadas las ofrendas florales a nombre del CC del PTC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros, de la RPDC, las organizaciones de masas, ministerios, organos centrales, las instituciones de educacion, prensa e informacion, los organismos del partido y el Poder y las granjas en esta capital. 
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio.

articles.title: Rinden homenaje a los martires con motivo del 15 de agosto lunar
articles.content:
Rinden homenaje a los martires con motivo del 15 de agosto lunar
						
Pyongyang, 1 de octubre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 15 de agosto lunar (fiesta folclorica), fueron depositadas la vispera las ofrendas florales ante el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios del Monte Taesong y el de Martires Patrioticos.
					Estaban colocadas en ambos lugares las ofrendas enviadas por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					En las ceremonias de homenaje estuvieron presentes Choe Yong Rim y otros cuadros del partido, el Estado y el ejercito, los funcionarios de las instituciones del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, las organizaciones de masas, ministerios y organos centrales, los oficiales y soldados del EPC y el Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea, asi como los trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					Fueron depositadas las ofrendas florales en nombre del CC del PTC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros, de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Seguidamente, fueron colocadas las otras en nombre de las organizaciones de masas, ministerios, organos centrales, las unidades del EPC y el ESIPC, las ramas de educacion, salud publica, prensa e informacion, los organos del partido y el poder, las empresas y las granjas en la capital, etc.
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de los martires.
					
					Ese dia, tuvieron lugar los mismos actos ante las estatuas de bronce y cementerios de los martires, los monumentos a los martires del EPC y las tumbas de los mismos.

articles.title: Acuerdan hermanar Haeju y Ulan-Ude
articles.content:
Acuerdan hermanar Haeju y Ulan-Ude
						
Pyongyang, 1 de octubre (ACNC) -- Quedo firmado el 30 de septiembre en la ciudad de Haeju de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur un acuerdo sobre el hermanamiento entre esta ciudad coreana y la de Ulan-Ude de la Republica de Bryatia de la Federacion Rusa.
					  En la ceremonia de firmas estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el presidente del Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Haeju, Ri Sung Chon, y otros funcionarios y por la rusa, los miembros de la delegacion de la ciudad de Ulan-Ude encabezada por su alcalde, Guennadi Aidayev.

articles.title: Actos dedicados a Dia Internacional de Ancianos
articles.content:
Actos dedicados a Dia Internacional de Ancianos
						
Pyongyang, 1 de octubre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar este lunes diversos actos dedicados al Dia Internacional de los Ancianos.
					Se efectuo en el Teatro del Pueblo el concierto de la Orquesta Sinfonica Nacional dedicado al Dia Internacional de los Ancianos.
					
					Lo presenciaron Yang Hyong Sop, Kwak Pom Gi, Mun Kyong Dok y otros funcionarios, los veteranos de guerra, los benemeritos y los ancianos de esta capital, asi como los representantes diplomaticos y  miembros de embajadas de varios paises y de las representaciones de las organizaciones internacionales en Corea.
					
					En el concierto, iniciado con la interpretacion de la musica orquestal "Himno al Mariscal                 Kim Il Sung", se presentaron variadas piezas incluyendo la musica orquestal "Nuestro General es el mejor" y el poema sinfonico "No tiene fin la anoranza".
					
					Este dia, los ancianos disfrutaron  de un momento dichoso de descanso en los parques de recreo.
					
					Los peculiares son la competencia de pesca y la de recreo folklorico en la pintoresca ribera del rio Taedong y juegos de los ancianos en el parque de Phalgol.
					
					Se desplegaron los bailes de los ancianos en los lugares pintorescos de esta capital incluyendo el lugar de recreo Moranbong y el paseadero del rio Taedong.
					
					Los aspectos de los ancianos quienes bailan al son de las melodias folcloricas avivaron el panorama de esta capital.
					
					Tambien los ancianos probaron los platos sabrosos en las redes gastronomicas y los establecimientos de servicio publico incluyendo los restaurantes de Okryu y Chongryu.
					
					Los funcionarios de las instituciones del Partido y el Poder entregaron los articulos de primera necesidad y los materiales de ayuda al visitar las familias de los veteranos de guerra y los benemeritos y los asilos de ancianos.
					
					Tambien tuvieron lugar en todas localidades del pais los similares actos por el Dia Internacional de los Ancianos.
